title.narrative: Bringing Unity, Integrity, and Legitimacy to Democracy (BUILD) in Somalia

description.narrative: (Somalia): .Although Somalia is moving towards more inclusive institutions and systems, there is a long way to go to ensure the political inclusion of all Somalis, particularly youth, women, and marginalized clans. In late 2020 or early 2021, Somalia is scheduled to hold its first planned one person, one vote elections in more than fifty years. .USAID promotes political inclusion by strengthening electoral and political processes across Somalia and supporting joint international donor efforts for planned upcoming elections. USAID also builds civil society organizations' capacity to engage citizens and monitor elections and political processes, strengthens the capacity of election management bodies to administer credible elections, and supports the development of viable, issue-based political parties. As elections approach, USAID will focus on enabling a credible and more inclusive process that is accepted by Somalis and enhances Somalia's stability. .With FY 2019 resources, USAID will increase its focus on political parties in response to closing political space. Credible political parties offer the best hope of moving Somalia beyond clan-based politics. USAID will continue to focus on increasing women, youth, and other marginalized groups' participation in the political process by promoting increased civic engagement and strengthening the capacity of civil society organizations and the media to advocate for their greater political inclusion. To strengthen the enabling environment for political inclusion, USAID will support the development and adoptions of laws, regulations, policies, and best practices. This will ensure that each stage of the electoral cycle enables greater inclusion on the one hand, while strengthening the capacity of key institutions to administer the process on the other. ...
